text: I found an old Maude interface I had done. It's a bit clunky as you have to parse the results from an XML file. Also to properly interface with Julia you'd have to generate Maude code. Are there any mature rewriting software that would be easier to interface with?

elements.text: I found an old Maude interface I had done. It's a bit clunky as you have to parse the results from an XML file. Also to properly interface with Julia you'd have to generate Maude code. Are there any mature rewriting software that would be easier to interface with?

text: There’s native Julia rewriting functionality in SymbolicUtils.jl. There are also Julia interfaces Reduce.jl and Maxima.jl. What are you looking for?

elements.text: There’s native Julia rewriting functionality in SymbolicUtils.jl. There are also Julia interfaces Reduce.jl and Maxima.jl. What are you looking for?

text: I'm aware of SymbolicUtils, Reduce and Maxima. Maude is more mature and has more features like equational logic. I'm not sure if Maxima or Reduce support user types.

elements.text: I'm aware of SymbolicUtils, Reduce and Maxima. Maude is more mature and has more features like equational logic. I'm not sure if Maxima or Reduce support user types.
